column4: I have linux xubuntu and I have no idea how to use skype, when I call someone he cannot hear me, I can hear him
have you confirmed your mic works first
Applications/Sound and video/sound recorder is a good start

what im saying is do the following. In your sound preferences confirm that your "input" is the mic of your computer you want to use and that it's not muted and levels are turned to appropriate volumes
also in skype there are a few volume controls you need to check
what's hard is i can't tell you where or what to look because the menus are diff if you're on xubuntu
that's why im saying to first test it in a program such as sound recorder
if your sound works in sound recorder but not skype then we can narrow it down to skype
no...
you shouldn't have to
that means when you open sound recorder it's "turning on" or adjusting your sound preferences, you shouldn't have to have it open to use it
yes
let me check mine
im using pulse audio for all of my settings on that page
this is in skype im talking about
i thought you said you got it working
but just not in skype
how did you install skype?
perhaps we can uninstall and then reinstall using the mediabuntu repo which has a few sound fixes?
yes but skype shouldn't be in there in the default repositories
pm me
